title: xenapi virt layer mount disk on build issues

comments.content:
I noticed 'sudo mount' failing in compute logs... and wondered why we attach the VDI to compute host and try to mount it at all.

It looks like there's some logic like this:

mount root disk
if it succeeds, see if the xe-daemon is there.  If it is, do nothing.  If it is not there, inject a bunch of stuff (files, network data, etc)
unmount disk

Problems:

1) _mount_filesystem() doesn't include 'ext4' as an option... which my image uses.. which is why the mount fails.
2) If I were to add 'ext4', I'm going to guess nova will stomp on the work that the unix guest agent (nova-agent) will do (or the reverse of this, I guess it would be)

Possible solutions:
1) Add 'ext4' (and 'reiserfs?) to _mount_filesystem()... and check for presence of 'nova-agent' and not 'xe-daemon'?

or:

2) We should remove the call to 'preconfigure_instance' all-together and make nova-agent required?  nova-agent supports a wider set of OSes...   We likely wouldn't want to try to mount a FreeBSD partition in Linux for instance.
